natural problem: Find the mean of all solutions for $x$ when $x^3 + 3x^2 - 10x = 0$.
natural solution: First, we factor the equation as $x(x^2 +3x - 10) = 0$.
So, one solution is $x=0$ and the other two solutions are the solutions to $x^2 + 3x-10=0$.
We could either factor the quadratic, or note that the sum of the solutions to this quadratic is $-(3/1)=-3$, so the mean of the three solutions to the original equation is $-3/3=\boxed{-1}$.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = x powr 3 + 3 * x powr 2 - 10 * x"
and h1 : "f x = 0"
shows  "average (roots f) = -1"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the mean of all solutions for $x$ when $x^3 + 3x^2 - 10x = 0$. The final Answer is -1
 ### Proof
 First, we factor the equation as $x(x^2 +3x - 10) = 0$.
 So, one solution is $x=0$ and the other two solutions are the solutions to $x^2 + 3x-10=0$.
 We could either factor the quadratic, or note that the sum of the solutions to this quadratic is $-(3/1)=-3$, so the mean of the three solutions to the original equation is $-3/3=\boxed{-1}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = x powr 3 + 3 * x powr 2 - 10 * x"
and h1 : "f x = 0"
shows  "average (roots f) = -1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the average of the roots of the cubic equation $x^3 + 3x^2 - 10x = 0$. The final answer is $-1$.

a_1.formal problem:

fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "x powr 3 + 3 * x powr 2 - 10 * x = 0"
shows  "mean (set (solve x powr 3 + 3 * x powr 2 - 10 * x = 0)) = -1"
a_1.formal solution:

fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "x powr 3 + 3 * x powr 2 - 10 * x = 0"

shows  "mean {x. f x = 0} = -1"

assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = x powr 3 + 3 * x powr 2 - 10 * x"

shows  "mean {x. f x = 0} = -1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer

a_6.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x powr 3 + 3 * x powr 2 - 10 * x"
and h1 : "P x = 0"
and h2 : "mean_of_all_solutions = (\<Sum>x. x) / (\<Sum>x. 1)"
shows  "mean_of_all_solutions = -1"
a_6.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the mean of all solutions for $x$ when $x^3 + 3x^2 - 10x = 0$. The final Answer is -1

 *)

fixes x :: real and P :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x powr 3 + 3 * x powr 2 - 10 * x"
and h1 : "P x = 0"
and h2 : "mean_of_all_solutions = (\<Sum>x. x) / (\<Sum>x. 1)"
shows  "mean_of_all_solutions = -1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer

a_9.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x powr 3 + 3 * x powr 2 - 10 * x"
and h1 : "P x = 0"
shows  "(SUM x | P x = 0. x) / (card {x. P x = 0}) = -1"
a_9.formal solution:
(* ### Problem

assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x powr 3 + 3 * x powr 2 - 10 * x"
and h1 : "P x = 0"
shows  "(SUM x | P x = 0. x) / (card {x. P x = 0}) = -1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
